verses.text: After David had settled in his house, he said to Nathan the prophet, "I am living in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the LORD is under a tent."
verses.comment: Follows the original sequence; 'house of cedar' refers to David's palace; 'tent' is literally 'curtains'.

verses.text: Nathan said to David, "Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you."
verses.comment: Direct translation; literally David’s inner intent.

verses.text: But that night the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
verses.comment: Maintains the Hebrew idiom 'the word of God came'.

verses.text: "Go and tell my servant David, ‘This is what the LORD says: You are not the one to build me a house to dwell in.
verses.comment: 'Servant David' follows Hebrew style. ‘House’ means temple.

verses.text: For I have not lived in a house from the day I brought up Israel until today, but I have gone from tent to tent and from one dwelling to another.
verses.comment: "Gone from tent to tent" is literal rendering of the Hebrew wording.

verses.text: In all the places where I have moved with all Israel, did I ever speak a word with any of the judges of Israel whom I commanded to shepherd my people, saying, ‘Why have you not built me a house of cedar?’”
verses.comment: 'Judges' could mean rulers or leaders. 'Shepherd' is literal.

verses.text: Now, therefore, say this to my servant David: ‘This is what the LORD of hosts says: I took you from the pasture, from following the sheep, to be ruler over my people Israel.
verses.comment: 'Ruler' is the same Hebrew word for 'prince' or 'leader.'

verses.text: I have been with you wherever you have gone and have cut off all your enemies from before you. And I will make you a name like the name of the great ones who are on the earth.
verses.comment: 'Cut off' means destroyed or removed.

verses.text: I will appoint a place for my people Israel and plant them, so that they may dwell in their own place and be disturbed no more. Wicked men will not waste them anymore, as formerly,
verses.comment: 'Waste' means oppress, afflict; matches the Hebrew term.

verses.text: from the time that I appointed judges over my people Israel. And I will subdue all your enemies. Moreover, I declare to you that the LORD will build you a house.
verses.comment: ‘Build you a house’ means establish a dynasty for you.

verses.text: When your days are fulfilled to walk with your fathers, I will raise up your descendant after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom.
verses.comment: 'Walk with your fathers' is a Hebrew idiom for dying.

verses.text: He shall build a house for me, and I will establish his throne forever.
verses.comment: 'Forever' is in the original, meaning perpetuity.

verses.text: I will be a father to him, and he will be a son to me. I will not take my steadfast love from him, as I took it from him who was before you.
verses.comment: 'Him who was before you' refers to Saul.

verses.text: But I will confirm him in my house and in my kingdom forever, and his throne shall be established forever.
verses.comment: 'Confirm' and 'establish' both mean to secure or fix.

verses.text: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, Nathan spoke to David.
verses.comment: Literal rendering; vision refers to the revelation given.

verses.text: Then King David went in and sat before the LORD and said, "Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my house, that you have brought me this far?
verses.comment: 'Went in' refers to entering the tent/Tabernacle.

verses.text: And even this was a small thing in your eyes, O God; you have also spoken about your servant's house for a great while to come, and have shown me future generations, O LORD God!
verses.comment: ‘Future generations’ literally 'law/charter of mankind'; reflects textual variant.

verses.text: What more can David say to you for the honor given to your servant? For you know your servant.
verses.comment: Follows the original form, directly addressing God.

verses.text: O LORD, for your servant’s sake, and according to your own heart, you have done all this greatness, to make known all these great things.
verses.comment: 'According to your own heart' means by your will/desire.

verses.text: O LORD, there is none like you, and there is no God besides you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.comment: Echoes standard OT monotheism.

verses.text: And who is like your people Israel, the one nation on earth whom God went out to redeem as his people, to make for yourself a name for great and awesome deeds, by driving out nations before your people, whom you redeemed out of Egypt?
verses.comment: 'Redeemed' means rescued, delivered.

verses.text: And you made your people Israel to be your own people forever, and you, O LORD, became their God.
verses.comment: Literally, 'forever'; covenant language.

verses.text: Now, O LORD, let the word you have spoken concerning your servant and his house be established forever, and do as you have said.
verses.comment: Directly asks God to fulfill His promise.

verses.text: Let your name be established and magnified forever, saying, ‘The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, is Israel’s God,’ and let the house of your servant David be established before you.
verses.comment: ‘Magnified’ = made great.

verses.text: For you, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build him a house; therefore your servant has found courage to pray before you.
verses.comment: 'Build him a house' means dynasty.

verses.text: And now, O LORD, you are God, and you have promised this good thing to your servant.
verses.comment: Literal translation of David’s prayer.

verses.text: Now you have been pleased to bless the house of your servant, so that it may continue forever before you; for you, O LORD, have blessed it, and it is blessed forever."
verses.comment: 'Forever' repeated for emphasis in the original.
